Articles.Content: Best Christmas present ever. I would highly recommend nanoblocks to any lego/space enthusiast as they are a lot of fun to put together. Hopefully next year I'll be lucky enough to get my hands on the ISS or the deluxe Space Shuttle.

I once got a nanoblock set a couple years ago. It was the Eiffel Tower, I believe. I haven't bought any more though because they're so expensive. But I had no idea there was a space shuttle one! I have some reevaluating to do.
Ahh, I once gave this exact set out to a friend as a Christmas gift.
Ah that's nice well done! But one question is nano blocks like Lego?

It is exactly like lego except: 1) The pieces tend to be smaller which allows for increased detail; 2) The female block connectors allow a little more flexibility when positioning and 3) It doesn't hurt as much when you step on the pieces.
